intro: Rhodamnia toratot, commonly known as the mountain pepper, is a small to medium-sized evergreen shrub or tree native to the subtropical regions of eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes other well-known plants like eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, woody stems and lance-shaped, glossy dark green leaves. Its small white or pinkish flowers appear in clusters and are followed by edible, peppery berries that are often used in traditional bush tucker. Rhodamnia toratot plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
